Title: Nationwide geospatial analysis of county racial and ethnic composition and public drinking water arsenic and uranium
Summary: Environmental justice and drinking water in the US: Higher proportions of Hispanic/Latino, American Indian/Alaskan Native, and non-Hispanic Black residents were associated with higher public water arsenic and uranium at the county-level, findings differed by region.

Title: Potential biomechanical risk factors on developing lead knee osteoarthritis in the golf swing
Comparison of changes in lipid profiles of premenopausal women with early-stage breast cancer treated with different endocrine therapies
Multi-organ imaging demonstrates the heart-brain-liver axis in UK Biobank participants
Summary: While heart disease, dementia and liver disease often co-occur, multi-organ imaging is needed for deeper elucidation of these cross-organ links. Here, the authors use image-derived phenotypes to describe underlying associations between heart, brain and liver health in a large population cohort.

Title: Arterial stiffness (from monitoring of Qkd interval) predict the occurrence of cardiovascular events and total mortality
Strong relationship between dyslipidemia and the ectopic ossification of the spinal ligaments
Prevalence of perinatal factors in infants with brachial plexus birth injuries and their association with injury severity
Analysis of clinical presentations, lip transepidermal water loss and associated dermatological conditions in patients with chronic cheilitis
Sexual dysfunction is more common among men who have high sperm DNA fragmentation or teratozoopermia
Climate-friendly and nutrition-sensitive interventions can close the global dietary nutrient gap while reducing GHG emissions
Summary: Estimates of greenhouse gas emissions associated with feeding the world population rarely account for specific nutrient gaps. This study applies a composite indicator of emissions intensity of nutrient production to calculate non-CO2 emissions of closing the global dietary gaps for energy, protein, iron, zinc, vitamin A, vitamin B12 and folate in 2030 under five climate-friendly scenarios.
